![**Figure 1**: Frequency of hake stomachs collected from 1988-2019, containing Pacific hake (in green) or other food items (in purple).](./plots/diet/hake_cannibalism.png)

![**Figure 2**: Dirichlet-weighted diet proportion by weight of cannibalism by predator hake age and prey hake age for three periods: all years in the dataset, the period of high observed cannibalism (1991-1999), and the period of low observed cannibalism (2005-2019).](./plots/diet/Dirichlet/Dirichlet_comp_pretty.png)

![**Figure 3**: Proportion of hake stomachs containing Pacific hake by location and sampling month, per year of sampling.](./plots/diet/locations_timing.png)

![**Figure 4**: Spawning stock biomass (Mt), total biomass (Mt), and age-1 recruitment (millions) with 95% confidence interval (shaded region) for Pacific hake from CEATTLE model in single-species mode with no predation, from the CEATTLE model in cannibalism mode with the average diet data for the entire period, and from the 2020 stock assessment. The vertical line represents the end of the hindcast (2019) for the 2020 assessment.](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/popdyn.png)

![**Figure 5**: Numbers-at-age from the CEATTLE model with the average cannibalism data for the entire period and from the 2020 stock assessment. The vertical line represents the end of the hindcast (2019) for the 2020 assessment.](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/nbyage.png)

![**Figure 6**: Residual (M1) and predation (M2) mortality by age and year for the CEATTLE model with the cannibalism data for the entire period. The vertical line represents the end of the hindcast (2019) for the 2020 assessment.](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/M.png)

![**Figure 7**: Spawning stock biomass (Mt), Total biomass (Mt), and recruitment (millions) with 95% confidence interval (shaded region), and mean age for the CEATTLE model using the mean observed cannibalism data and the observed data scaled to varying proportions (0.5% to 75%).](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/Testing/sensitivity_meanage_popdy.png)

![**Figure 8**: Spawning stock biomass (Mt), total biomass (Mt), and recruitment (millions) with 95% confidence interval (shaded region) for Pacific hake from the CEATTLE model with the estimate of mean cannibalism and for periods of high (1988-1999) and low (2005-2019) observed cannibalism.](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/Testing/timevarying_popdy.png)

![**Figure 9**: Residual (M1) and predation (M2) mortality by age and year for the CEATTLE model with the estimate of mean cannibalism for the entire period and for periods of high (1988-1999) and low (2005-2019) observed cannibalism.](./plots/CEATTLE/cannibalism/Testing/timevarying_M.png)
